newsitem.title: POLAND: Polish insurers' gross premiums up 46 pct in 1996.
newsitem.headline: Polish insurers' gross premiums up 46 pct in 1996.

text.p: The gross premiums of Polish insurance firms increased 46 percent to 8.17 billion zlotys in 1996, the Central Statistical Office (GUS) said on Friday.
Gross premiums for life insurance firms rose 49 percent to 2.77 billion zlotys and increased 45 percent to 5.4 billion for non-life insurers.
The net profit for all Polish insurers increased 67 percent to 76.1 million zlotys in 1996, but non-life firms registered a 42.6 million zloty loss last year.
Last year 23 Polish insurers had a net profit and 19 had losses. In 1995, 23 firms had a profit and 16 were in the red.
